column4: eth0 is a direct connection to the net. eth1 is to my home lan (for samba)
you tried checking the interfaces file then just rebooting?
Several times.
zuul is my firewall on eth1.
Yes.
not that i know of. looks weird that you're getting 254.254 when that'd be of no use at all.
can you pastebin your interfaces file?
http://pastebin.com/m49832994
so your network goes how? cable -> eth0 of PC, eth1 of PC <-> firewall ?
Close, but not quite.
DSL -> eth0 of PC.
Then we have Firewall -> LAN -> eth1 of PC
ooh-err, bit more complex than i can follow, what's the route of a packet out to the Internet from a client PC then?
That would be: client pc -> Firewall -> outside
The ONLY thing eth1 should connect to is the local lan. it shouldn't be using the firewall.
hmm that's not how i'd do it, i'd just have the one machine with two interfaces firewall'ing and routing. don't see the need for two separate subnets
This system is a server for kjsr.net's streaming feed. We have a dedicated DSL connection for it on eth0.
eth1 is just for local access to the shared drives.
ok sorry i don't really follow well enough to help. if i wanted to get rid of those routes though i'd either reinstall the OS or backup and delete interfaces to try from scratch
Way too drastic.
Got the routing fixed, I think... But web is still down.
